bug.author: memozhu
bug.summary: In the run.py file, the variable "envs" does not have a attribute "ENV_IGNORE"
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24536530/54912344-651b8080-4f2b-11e9-91fa-15d949f73843.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24536530/54912371-75cbf680-4f2b-11e9-9f6f-40da57b82c70.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24536530/54911665-ed008b00-4f29-11e9-993c-85975d954bba.png></denchmark-link>
Maybe there is something wrong with the "env" variable name. How can I solve it?

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/memozhu>@memozhu</denchmark-link> , looks like there was a name clash. I've updated <denchmark-link:https://github.com/horovod/horovod/pull/949>#949</denchmark-link> with the fix. Could you re-install and try again?
